required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Simvastatin and Ezetimibe on Cardiovascular Risk Markers in Patients With Dyslipidemia
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Lipoprotein Subfractions, Inflammation, Oxidative Stress and Endothelial Function After Treatment With Simvastatin and Ezetimibe Administered Alone and in Combination in Hyperlipidemic Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundación para el Fomento de la Investigación Sanitaria y Biomédica de la Comunitat Valenciana

clinical_study.source: Fundación para el Fomento de la Investigación Sanitaria y Biomédica de la Comunitat Valenciana

brief_summary.textblock: Coadministration of drugs is common in the pharmacologic treatment of dyslipidemia, with statins and ezetimibe generally constituting the medication of choice. By acting at different levels, the combination of these drugs allows the therapeutic objective to be achieved. However, it is not known how these drugs qualitatively affect the composition of lipoprotein subfractions, which differ in size and atherogenic potential. The investigators set out to evaluate this effect as well as their effects on inflammatory, oxidative stress and endothelial function parameters.

detailed_description.textblock: The study consisted of a randomised parallel trial and took place during a period of 2 months. A total of 42 hyperlipidemic patients were randomly assigned to one of 2 groups: one received simvastatin (40 mg/day) and the other received ezetimibe (10 mg/day) for 4 weeks, after which both groups were administered combined therapy for an additional 4-week period. Lipid profile, lipoprotein subfractions of LDL and HDL, inflammatory, oxidative stress and endothelial function parameters were evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Total Cholesterol Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
primary_outcome.description: Total cholesterol concentration was measured by enzymatic assay

primary_outcome.measure: Low-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDLc) Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
primary_outcome.description: Low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDLc) concentration was calculated using the method of Friedewald.

primary_outcome.measure: High-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDLc) Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
primary_outcome.description: High-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDLc) concentration was measured using a direct method

primary_outcome.measure: Triglycerides Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
primary_outcome.description: Triglyceride concentration were measured by enzymatic assay

primary_outcome.measure: Non-HDL Cholesterol Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
primary_outcome.description: Non-HDLc concentration was obtained by calculating the difference between total cholesterol and HDLc

primary_outcome.measure: Low Density Lipoprotein Size Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
primary_outcome.description: LDL subfractions were separated by high-resolution polyacrylamide gel tubes using the Lipoprint® system. The LDL electrophoretic profile allows 2 patterns to be defined: pattern A or large and buoyant LDL, and pattern non-A or small and dense LDL.

primary_outcome.measure: Apolipoprotein B Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
primary_outcome.description: Levels of apolipoprotein B were determined by inmunonephelometry

secondary_outcome.measure: Levels of High-sensitive C-reactive Protein (hsCRP) Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Levels of high-sensitive C-reactive protein (hsCRP) were analysed by a latex-enhanced inmunonephelometric assay

secondary_outcome.measure: Levels of Interleukin-6 (IL-6) Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Levels of proinflammatory cytokines (interleukin-6 (IL-6)) were analysed with a Luminex® 200™ system

secondary_outcome.measure: Levels of Tumor Necrosis Factor α (TNF-α) Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Levels of proinflammatory cytokines (tumor necrosis factor α (TNF-α)) were analysed with a Luminex® 200™ system

secondary_outcome.measure: Mitochondrial Oxygen (O2) Consumption Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Oxidative stress markers (mitochondrial oxygen (O2) consumption) was measured at baseline and after treatment by Clark electrode

secondary_outcome.measure: Reactive Oxygen Species (ROS) Production Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Oxidative stress markers (Reactive oxygen species (ROS) production) was measured at baseline and after treatment by fluorometric techniques

secondary_outcome.measure: Membrane Potential Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Oxidative stress markers (membrane potential) was measured at baseline and after treatment by fluorometric techniques

secondary_outcome.measure: Levels of Glutathione (GSH) Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Oxidative stress markers (levels of glutathione (GSH)) was measured at baseline and after treatment by fluorometric techniques

secondary_outcome.measure: Leukocyte Rolling Flux Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Interactions between leukocytes and human umbilical vein endothelial cells were evaluated by flow chamber microscopy. Leukocyte rolling was estimated as the number of leukocytes rolling over 100 μm2 of the endothelial monolayer during a 1-min period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Leukocyte Adhesion Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Interactions between leukocytes and human umbilical vein endothelial cells were evaluated by flow chamber microscopy. Adhesion was evaluated by counting the number of polymorphonuclear cells that maintained stable contact with human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVEC) for 30 seconds.

secondary_outcome.measure: Leukocyte Rolling Velocity Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Interactions between leukocytes and human umbilical vein endothelial cells were evaluated by flow chamber microscopy.The rolling velocity in the field of focus was determined by measuring the time required by 20 consecutive leukocytes to cover a distance of 100 μm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Levels of Vascular Cell Adhesion Molecule 1 (VCAM-1) Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
secondary_outcome.description: The vascular cell adhesion molecule 1 (VCAM-1) was evaluated in serum by Luminex® 200™ system

secondary_outcome.measure: Levels of Intercellular Adhesion Molecule 1 (ICAM-1) Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
secondary_outcome.description: The intercellular adhesion molecule 1 (ICAM-1) was evaluated in serum by Luminex® 200™ system

secondary_outcome.measure: Levels of E-selectin Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
secondary_outcome.description: E-selectin was evaluated in serum by Luminex® 200™ system

arm_group.description: Hyperlipidemic patients received simvastatin (40 mg/day) for 4 weeks, after they were administered combined therapy (simvastatin, 40 mg/day plus ezetimibe,10 mg/day) for an additional 4-week period. Lipid profile, lipoprotein subfractions of LDL and HDL, inflammatory, oxidative stress and endothelial function parameters were evaluated.

Hyperlipidemic patients received ezetimibe (10 mg/day) for 4 weeks, after they were administered combined therapy (simvastatin, 40 mg/day plus ezetimibe,10 mg/day) for an additional 4-week period. Lipid profile, lipoprotein subfractions of LDL and HDL, inflammatory, oxidative stress and endothelial function parameters were evaluated.

intervention.description: combined therapy simvastatin (40 mg/day) + ezetimibe (10 mg/day) for 4-week period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- LDL cholesterol concentration of between 160-190 mg/dl in patients with less than 2 cardiovascular risk factors
- LDL concentration of between 130-160 mg/dl in patients that presented 2 or more cardiovascular risk factors.
Cardiovascular risk factors were defined as: age (≥ 45 years in men and ≥55 years in women), a smoking habit, hypertension (≥140/90 mmHg), diabetes mellitus, a high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol concentration of ≤ 40mg/dl, and a family history of cardiovascular disease.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Triglyceride concentration > 400 mg/dl
- Diabetes Mellitus
- Kidney, liver, or thyroid disease

reference.citation: Berneis K, Rizzo M, Berthold HK, Spinas GA, Krone W, Gouni-Berthold I. Ezetimibe alone or in combination with simvastatin increases small dense low-density lipoproteins in healthy men: a randomized trial. Eur Heart J. 2010 Jul;31(13):1633-9. doi: 10.1093/eurheartj/ehq181. Epub 2010 Jun 6.

Florentin M, Liberopoulos EN, Moutzouri E, Rizos CV, Tselepis AD, Elisaf MS. The effect of simvastatin alone versus simvastatin plus ezetimibe on the concentration of small dense low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in subjects with primary hypercholesterolemia. Curr Med Res Opin. 2011 Mar;27(3):685-92. doi: 10.1185/03007995.2010.546394. Epub 2011 Jan 27.

Bays HE, Ose L, Fraser N, Tribble DL, Quinto K, Reyes R, Johnson-Levonas AO, Sapre A, Donahue SR; Ezetimibe Study Group. A multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, factorial design study to evaluate the lipid-altering efficacy and safety profile of the ezetimibe/simvastatin tablet compared with ezetimibe and simvastatin monotherapy in patients with primary hypercholesterolemia. Clin Ther. 2004 Nov;26(11):1758-73.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Fundación para el Fomento de la Investigación Sanitaria y Biomédica de la Comunitat Valenciana

group.title: Simvastatin
group.description: 20 hyperlipidemic patients received simvastatin (40 mg/day) for 4 weeks, after they were administered combined therapy (simvastatin, 40 mg/day plus ezetimibe,10 mg/day) for an additional 4-week period. Lipid profile, lipoprotein subfractions of LDL and HDL, inflammatory, oxidative stress and endothelial function parameters were evaluated. Simvastatin: simvastatin (40 mg/day) for 4 weeks Simvastatin + Ezetimibe: combined therapy simvastatin (40 mg/day) + ezetimibe (10 mg/day) for 4-week period

group.title: Simvastatin
group.description: Hyperlipidemic patients received simvastatin (40 mg/day) for 4 weeks, after they were administered combined therapy (simvastatin, 40 mg/day plus ezetimibe,10 mg/day) for an additional 4-week period. Lipid profile, lipoprotein subfractions of LDL and HDL, inflammatory, oxidative stress and endothelial function parameters were evaluated. Simvastatin: simvastatin (40 mg/day) for 4 weeks Simvastatin + Ezetimibe: combined therapy simvastatin (40 mg/day) + ezetimibe (10 mg/day) for 4-week period

group.title: Ezetimibe
group.description: Hyperlipidemic patients received ezetimibe (10 mg/day) for 4 weeks, after they were administered combined therapy (simvastatin, 40 mg/day plus ezetimibe,10 mg/day) for an additional 4-week period. Lipid profile, lipoprotein subfractions of LDL and HDL, inflammatory, oxidative stress and endothelial function parameters were evaluated. Ezetimibe: ezetimibe (10 mg/day) for 4 weeks Simvastatin + Ezetimibe: combined therapy simvastatin (40 mg/day) + ezetimibe (10 mg/day) for 4-week period

measure.title: Non-HDL Cholesterol Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
measure.description: Non-HDLc concentration was obtained by calculating the difference between total cholesterol and HDLc

outcome.title: Low Density Lipoprotein Size Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
outcome.description: LDL subfractions were separated by high-resolution polyacrylamide gel tubes using the Lipoprint® system. The LDL electrophoretic profile allows 2 patterns to be defined: pattern A or large and buoyant LDL, and pattern non-A or small and dense LDL.

group.title: Simvastatin
group.description: 20 hyperlipidemic patients received simvastatin (40 mg/day) for 4 weeks, after they were administered combined therapy (simvastatin, 40 mg/day plus ezetimibe,10 mg/day) for an additional 4-week period. Lipid profile, lipoprotein subfractions of LDL and HDL, inflammatory, oxidative stress and endothelial function parameters were evaluated. Simvastatin: simvastatin (40 mg/day) for 4 weeks Simvastatin + Ezetimibe: combined therapy simvastatin (40 mg/day) + ezetimibe (10 mg/day) for 4-week period

group.title: Ezetimibe
group.description: 19 hyperlipidemic patients received ezetimibe (10 mg/day) for 4 weeks, after they were administered combined therapy (simvastatin, 40 mg/day plus ezetimibe,10 mg/day) for an additional 4-week period. Lipid profile, lipoprotein subfractions of LDL and HDL, inflammatory, oxidative stress and endothelial function parameters were evaluated. measure.title: Low Density Lipoprotein Size Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
measure.description: LDL subfractions were separated by high-resolution polyacrylamide gel tubes using the Lipoprint® system. The LDL electrophoretic profile allows 2 patterns to be defined: pattern A or large and buoyant LDL, and pattern non-A or small and dense LDL.

outcome.title: Leukocyte Adhesion Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
outcome.description: Interactions between leukocytes and human umbilical vein endothelial cells were evaluated by flow chamber microscopy. Adhesion was evaluated by counting the number of polymorphonuclear cells that maintained stable contact with human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVEC) for 30 seconds.

group.title: Simvastatin
group.description: Hyperlipidemic patients received simvastatin (40 mg/day) for 4 weeks, after they were administered combined therapy (simvastatin, 40 mg/day plus ezetimibe,10 mg/day) for an additional 4-week period. measure.title: Leukocyte Adhesion Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
measure.description: Interactions between leukocytes and human umbilical vein endothelial cells were evaluated by flow chamber microscopy. Adhesion was evaluated by counting the number of polymorphonuclear cells that maintained stable contact with human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVEC) for 30 seconds.

outcome.title: Leukocyte Rolling Velocity Before and After Simvastatin/Ezetimibe Administration
outcome.description: Interactions between leukocytes and human umbilical vein endothelial cells were evaluated by flow chamber microscopy.The rolling velocity in the field of focus was determined by measuring the time required by 20 consecutive leukocytes to cover a distance of 100 μm.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
